title: Do not update remote clipboard before pasting or until a copy is made
author: aeb-dev
body_snippet:
I do not know how rdp works so this is basically a question about whether it is possible.

When I enable clipboard and connect to the remote server, server's clipboard is automatically updated with my local computer's clipboard.
Is there anyway to prevent this or can this be implemented?

The scenario is this: we are running a software that is using clipboard. If I connect while the software is running and if I had something on my local computer's clipboard, server's clipboard is updated. T...

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: Hello, so disable clipboard to not this happened? Or i am not get that is exactly you wish to got?

comments.author: aeb-dev
comments.snippet:
I want to be able to use it.

I am not sure if this is possible but, when I connect with clipboard enabled it should not update remote clipboard at first.
When I paste current clipboard or copy something new than it should update the remote.

Basically what I am saying is, is it possible to have an option to disable clipboard until new copy is made or paste command is pressed?

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet: I think this is the behavior of the Microsoft remote desktop to overwrite whatever is in the clipboard of the remote machine when connecting. As far as I know you can only or completely disable or fully enable it, I don't think it's possible to only send the information after the first copying when using the mstsc (or the library thereof used in this project I forgot the name of), though I like to be proven wrong :)
